meanings.definition: Bacteria that form nodules on the roots of leguminous plants and fix nitrogen.
meanings.sent1: The rhizobia help the plants by providing them with nitrogen.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on rhizobia to improve the soil quality in their fields.
meanings.sent3: The rhizobia threw a nitrogen-fixing party on the plant roots!
meanings.sent4: The rhizobia are like tiny nitrogen-fixing superheroes for the leguminous plants.
meanings.sent5: In the underground world of roots, the rhizobia work tirelessly to fix nitrogen for the plants.
